OllamaClient

Client for interacting with the Ollama API.

Module Contents

ollama_forge.client.TQDM_AVAILABLE = True[source]¶
ollama_forge.client.HELPERS_AVAILABLE = True[source]¶
ollama_forge.client.logger[source]¶
class ollama_forge.client.OllamaClient(base_url: str = DEFAULT_OLLAMA_API_URL, timeout: int = DEFAULT_TIMEOUT, max_retries: int = 3, session: requests.Session | None = None)[source]¶

Client for interacting with the Ollama API.

This class provides a comprehensive interface to all Ollama API endpoints, with support for both synchronous and asynchronous requests, streaming responses, and robust error handling.

base_url[source]¶

Base URL for the Ollama API

timeout[source]¶

Request timeout in seconds

max_retries[source]¶

Maximum number of retries for failed requests

Initialize the Ollama client.

Parameters:

  • base_url – Base URL for the Ollama API

  • timeout – Request timeout in seconds

  • max_retries – Maximum number of retries for failed requests

  • session – Optional requests.Session to use

base_url = ''[source]¶
timeout[source]¶
max_retries = 3[source]¶
session[source]¶
_thread_local[source]¶
_with_retry(method: str, endpoint: str, data: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False, headers: Dict[str, str] | None = None) → requests.Response | None[source]¶

Make an HTTP request with retry logic.

Parameters:

  • method – HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.)

  • endpoint – API endpoint to call

  • data – Request data

  • stream – Whether to stream the response

  • headers – Optional request headers

Returns:

Response object

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If connection fails after all retries

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the model is not found

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ServerError – If the server returns a 5xx error

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError – If the request is invalid

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.TimeoutError – If the request times out

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError – For other API errors

async _with_async_retry(method: str, endpoint: str, data: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False, headers: Dict[str, str] | None = None) → httpx.Response | None[source]¶
get_version() → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Get the Ollama server version.

Returns:

Dictionary with version information

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError – If the response is invalid

list_models() → Dict[str, List[Dict[str, Any]]][source]¶

List available models.

Returns:

Dictionary with models information

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError – If the response is invalid

pull_model(model: str, stream: bool = True) → Dict[str, Any] | Generator[Dict[str, Any], None, None][source]¶

Pull a model from the Ollama registry.

Parameters:

  • model – Name of the model to pull

  • stream – Whether to stream the progress

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding progress updates If stream=False, a dictionary with pull result

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError – If the model name is invalid

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.OllamaAPIError – If the response is invalid

generate(model: str, prompt: str, options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any] | Iterator[Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Generate text from a prompt.

Parameters:

  • model – Name of the model to use

  • prompt – The prompt to generate from

  • options – Dictionary of generation options

  • stream – Whether to stream the response

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding response chunks If stream=False, a dictionary with the complete response

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError – If the request is invalid

chat(model: str, messages: List[Dict[str, str]], options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, stream: bool = False) → Dict[str, Any] | Iterator[Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Chat with a model.

Parameters:

  • model – Name of the model

  • messages – List of message dictionaries (role, content)

  • options – Chat options

  • stream – Whether to stream the response

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding response chunks If stream=False, a dictionary with the complete response

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError – If the messages format is invalid

create_embedding(model: str, prompt: str, options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Create an embedding vector for a text prompt.

Parameters:

  • model – Name of the model

  • prompt – Text to create embedding for

  • options – Optional embedding parameters

Returns:

Dictionary with the embedding vector

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

batch_embeddings(model: str, prompts: List[str], options: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, show_progress: bool = False) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Create embeddings for multiple prompts.

Parameters:

  • model – Name of the model

  • prompts – List of texts to create embeddings for

  • options – Optional embedding parameters

  • show_progress – Whether to show a progress bar

Returns:

List of embedding vectors

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

delete_model(model: str) → bool[source]¶

Delete a model.

Parameters:

model – Name of the model to delete

Returns:

True if successful

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the model does not exist

copy_model(source: str, destination: str) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Copy a model.

Parameters:

  • source – Source model name

  • destination – Destination model name

Returns:

Dictionary with operation result

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ModelNotFoundError – If the source model does not exist

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError – If the destination name is invalid

create_model(name: str, modelfile: str, stream: bool = True) → Dict[str, Any] | Iterator[Dict[str, Any]][source]¶

Create a new model from a Modelfile.

Parameters:

  • name – Name for the new model

  • modelfile – Modelfile content

  • stream – Whether to stream the creation progress

Returns:

If stream=True, a generator yielding progress updates If stream=False, a dictionary with creation result

Raises:

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.ConnectionError – If cannot connect to Ollama server

  • ollama_forge.exceptions.InvalidRequestError – If the Modelfile is invalid

fallback_context(prompt: str, system_prompt: str | None = None) → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Context manager for automatic model fallback.

Parameters:

  • prompt – The user’s query or message

  • system_prompt – Optional system prompt to use

Returns:

Context dictionary with parameters

Example

with client.fallback_context(“chat”):response = client.chat(model, messages)

get_fallback_info() → Dict[str, Any][source]¶

Get information about the current fallback state.

Returns:

Dictionary containing fallback depth, model name, and original error
